title: Passive Voice: Continuous & Perfect
description: Слушайте пассивный залог в длительных и перфектных формах.

tasks.audioText: The road outside our office is a mess right now. It is being repaired by a construction crew this entire week.
tasks.transcript: It is being repaired by a construction crew this entire week.

options.text: A construction team is currently fixing the road throughout the week.
The road was repaired last week.
The road repair will start next month.
The road doesn't need any repairs.

tasks.explanation: 'Is being repaired' is Present Continuous Passive — the repair is in progress right now.

tasks.audioText: The investigation into the financial scandal has concluded. Three senior executives have been charged with fraud.
tasks.transcript: Three senior executives have been charged with fraud.

options.text: Three top managers received fraud charges as a result of the investigation.
The executives charged someone else with fraud.
No one has been charged yet.
The investigation is just beginning.

tasks.explanation: 'Have been charged' is Present Perfect Passive — a completed action with present relevance.

tasks.audioText: When we arrived at the hospital, everything was chaotic. Several patients were being treated in the corridors due to overcrowding.
tasks.transcript: Several patients were being treated in the corridors due to overcrowding.

options.text: Doctors were caring for patients in the hallways because there wasn't enough room.
Patients treated themselves in the corridors.
The hospital was empty when they arrived.
Patients are being treated in corridors right now.

tasks.explanation: 'Were being treated' is Past Continuous Passive — the treatment was ongoing at the time of arrival.

tasks.audioText: The company newsletter reported exciting progress. A revolutionary new drug has been developed by the research team over the past five years.
tasks.transcript: A revolutionary new drug has been developed by the research team over the past five years.

options.text: The research team created a groundbreaking medication during the last five years.
The drug will be developed in the next five years.
No drug has been developed yet.
The drug was developed fifty years ago.

tasks.explanation: 'Has been developed' is Present Perfect Passive — the development is complete with results relevant to the present.

tasks.audioText: Please be patient with the noise upstairs. New equipment is being installed in the laboratory as we speak.
tasks.transcript: New equipment is being installed in the laboratory as we speak.

options.text: The equipment installation was completed yesterday.
Workers are setting up new equipment in the lab right now.
The laboratory has no equipment.
The equipment will be installed next month.

tasks.explanation: 'Is being installed' is Present Continuous Passive — the installation is happening at this very moment.

tasks.audioText: The police report revealed new details about the robbery. The suspects had been monitored by detectives for several months before the arrest.
tasks.transcript: The suspects had been monitored by detectives for several months before the arrest.

options.text: Detectives watched the suspects for months prior to arresting them.
The suspects monitored the detectives.
The monitoring started after the arrest.
Nobody was monitoring the suspects.

tasks.explanation: 'Had been monitored' is Past Perfect Passive — the surveillance happened over a period before the later past event of the arrest.

tasks.audioText: The school building looks completely different. The classrooms have been painted in bright, cheerful colours over the summer holidays.
tasks.transcript: The classrooms have been painted in bright, cheerful colours over the summer holidays.

options.text: Someone painted the classrooms with vibrant colours during the summer break.
The classrooms are being painted right now.
The classrooms will be painted next summer.
The classrooms have always been these colours.

tasks.explanation: 'Have been painted' is Present Perfect Passive — the painting is complete and the result is visible now.

tasks.audioText: I noticed a lot of activity when I passed the town centre. A new stage was being constructed for the music festival next weekend.
tasks.transcript: A new stage was being constructed for the music festival next weekend.

options.text: Workers were building a stage for the upcoming festival when I walked by.
The stage was already finished when I passed.
The music festival was cancelled.
I was constructing the stage myself.

tasks.explanation: 'Was being constructed' is Past Continuous Passive — the construction was in progress at the time of passing.

tasks.audioText: The environmental report paints a grim picture. Over forty percent of the world's coral reefs have been damaged by rising ocean temperatures.
tasks.transcript: Over forty percent of the world's coral reefs have been damaged by rising ocean temperatures.

options.text: Rising sea temperatures have harmed more than forty percent of coral reefs globally.
Coral reefs are damaging the ocean temperatures.
All coral reefs remain perfectly healthy.
Coral reefs will be damaged in the distant future.

tasks.explanation: 'Have been damaged' is Present Perfect Passive — the damage has occurred over time and the effects are still relevant now.

tasks.audioText: The neighbours complained about the constant drilling sounds. Their flat was being renovated by a team of builders for over three months.
tasks.transcript: Their flat was being renovated by a team of builders for over three months.

options.text: The renovation finished before the neighbours moved in.
Builders were working on the flat for more than three months at that time.
The neighbours renovated the flat themselves.
No renovation took place in the building.

tasks.explanation: 'Was being renovated' is Past Continuous Passive — the renovation was an ongoing process lasting over three months.

tasks.audioText: The author was overwhelmed at the book launch. Her latest novel had been translated into twenty-seven languages before it even hit the shelves.
tasks.transcript: Her latest novel had been translated into twenty-seven languages before it even hit the shelves.

options.text: The book was translated into twenty-seven languages after it was published.
The novel was available in twenty-seven languages even before its official release.
The novel has not been translated yet.
The author translated the book herself.

tasks.explanation: 'Had been translated' is Past Perfect Passive — the translations were completed before the even earlier past event of the book's release.

tasks.audioText: The traffic situation is terrible on High Street. The main road is being widened to accommodate more vehicles during rush hour.
tasks.transcript: The main road is being widened to accommodate more vehicles during rush hour.

options.text: Construction workers are currently making the road wider for better traffic flow.
The road was widened ten years ago.
The road is being made narrower.
Vehicles are widening the road by driving on it.

tasks.explanation: 'Is being widened' is Present Continuous Passive — the road expansion is an ongoing project happening now.

tasks.audioText: The whistleblower's testimony shocked the courtroom. Confidential documents had been leaked to the press for over a year before anyone noticed.
tasks.transcript: Confidential documents had been leaked to the press for over a year before anyone noticed.

options.text: Someone discovered the leaks immediately.
Secret documents were shared with journalists for more than a year without detection.
The press leaked documents to the company.
No documents were ever leaked.

tasks.explanation: 'Had been leaked' is Past Perfect Passive — the leaking happened over time before the past moment of discovery.

tasks.audioText: The gallery has a spectacular new exhibition. All the artworks have been carefully selected from private collections around the world.
tasks.transcript: All the artworks have been carefully selected from private collections around the world.

options.text: The artworks are being selected right now.
Curators chose each artwork with care from international private collections.
The artworks were rejected from the exhibition.
All artworks came from a single local collection.

tasks.explanation: 'Have been selected' is Present Perfect Passive — the selection process is complete and the result is the current exhibition.

tasks.audioText: When we visited the factory last spring, production was running at full capacity. Electric cars were being assembled around the clock by robotic systems.
tasks.transcript: Electric cars were being assembled around the clock by robotic systems.

options.text: Robots were putting together electric vehicles non-stop when they visited.
Workers assembled the cars manually during the day only.
The factory had stopped production before the visit.
Electric cars are being assembled at the factory today.

tasks.explanation: 'Were being assembled' is Past Continuous Passive — continuous robotic production was happening at the time of the visit.

short_description: Пассивный залог: длительные и перфектные формы.
